intro: Convolvulus occidentalis var. solanensis, commonly known as the western bindweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, funnel-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas. Due to its aggressive growth, it can become invasive in certain regions.
